text: Linear Programming Term 1, Mon-Wed-Fri, 14:00-15:00 PM Sep 2023 - Dec 2023 Debut of Linear Programming Profiles in Operations Research Pioneers and Innovators p224 In 1948, at a conference at the University of Wisconsin- Madison, George B. Dantzig gave a talk: ‘‘Programming in a linear structure.’’ After the talk, the chairman called for discussion. One statistician raised hand and said: ‘But we all know the world is nonlinear.’ Having uttered this devastating criticism of Dantzig’s model, he majestically sat down. Debut of Linear Programming Profiles in Operations Research Pioneers and Innovators p224 While Dantzig was trying to compose a proper reply, suddenly another hand in the audience was raised. It was von Neumann. After receiving permission, Von Neumann said: ‘The speaker titled his talk ‘‘linear programming’’ and carefully stated his axioms. If you have an application that satisfies the axioms, well, use it. If it does not, then don’t,’ and he sat down. Debut of Linear Programming Profiles in Operations Research Pioneers and Innovators p224 In the final analysis, of course, the criticism was right. The world is highly nonlinear. Fortunately systems of linear inequalities (as opposed to equalities) permit us to approximate most of the kinds of nonlinear relations encountered in practical planning. Applications 1. Designing in Engineering 2. Manufacture and management 3. Transportation and route scheduling 4. Statistics and machine learning 5. And more Main textbook! 5th edition!
